definition: blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
blind/groundlessly/foolishly/to no purpose
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate

sentences.english: No one under the guidance of all blind elephant.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人來指導下，一切都是瞎子摸象。

sentences.english: In the story of An Elephant and Blind Men, the blind men were satirized for their unilateralism.
sentences.chinese: 在“瞎子摸象”的故事中，人因爲片面化而被嘲諷。

definition: blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to touch an elephant (of proverbial blind people)
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: lit. crossing the river by feeling for stones/improvise by trial-and-error/move cautiously
unable to see the wood for the trees/fig. only able to see isolated details, and not the bigger picture
pinyin: zhi3 jian4 shu4 mu4 bu4 jian4 sen1 lin2

definition: to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
lit. to look at flowers in the fog (idiom); fig. blurred vision
lit. to scoop the moon out of the water (idiom)/a hopeless endeavor
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
